description: Ms. codex. Physical description: Varying lines per page; written in shikastah in black on machine-made paper. Catchwords. Occasional staining and smudging. Origin: According to the published edition of text 3 (Durar al-fawāʼid fī al-ḥāshiyah ʻalá al-Farāʼid, Ṭihrān, 1990, p. 422), text 3 was completed in Rajab 1305 H [March-April 1888]. These texts were likely written down sometime before that date.
abstract: Collection of Shiʻite texts. With the exception of text 1, there are numerous cross-outs throughout the manuscript, suggesting that the remaining texts may be rough drafts in the hand of Muḥammad Kāẓim al-Khurāsānī, identified as the author of text 3.
extent: 151 leaves : paper ; 220 x 175 mm bound to 223 x 176 mm
title: [Ṣad ḥadīs̲] ... [etc.].
provenance: On leaf 2a: Owner's note and stamp dated 1321 H [1903 or 1904]. Owner's note of Muḥammad Bāqir al-Ḥusaynī Baḥr al-ʻUlūm dated 22 Muḥarram 1339 H [6 October 1920].
subject: Islamic law
binding_note: Full red leather with blind-tooled fillets.
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
